required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Active Surveillance Research Program for the Assessment of the Safety and the Effectiveness of Linagliptin
clinical_study.official_title: Active Surveillance Research Program for the Assessment of the Safety and the Effectiveness of Linagliptin

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is for a series of comparative effectiveness and safety analyses within periodically updated cohorts of patients initiating linagliptin, other DPP-4 inhibitors, and other oral hypoglycemic medications, followed longitudinally for the occurrence of a variety of health outcomes. The primary analysis will be conducted among patients without prior within-class medication use.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with major adverse cardiovascular event is presented by the number of patients reported a composite of: Coronary revascularization (elective and non-elective procedure) Acute coronary syndrome (ACS), including acute myocardial infarction (MI) Stroke (Ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Coronary Revascularization
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with coronary revascularization (elective and non-elective procedure)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Acute Coronary Syndrome
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with acute coronary syndrome (ACS). The definition for ACS included acute myocardial infarction (MI), but acute MI was not assessed separately.
Number of participants with ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke. Both types of stroke were included in the definition for stroke, but were not assessed separately

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Heart Failure Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with heart failure hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incident End Stage Renal Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with incident end stage renal disease (ESRD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Acute Renal Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with acute renal failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Acute Renal Failure Requiring Dialysis
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with acute renal failure requiring dialysis

study_pop.textblock: T2DM patients aged 18 or older, initiating antidiabetic treatment after at least 6 months of continuous enrollment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- A dispensing of an oral hypoglycemic medication
- A diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM)
Exclusion criteria:
- less than 18 years old
- missing or ambiguous age or sex information
- at least one diagnosis of type 1 diabetes mellitus
- less than 6 months enrolment in the database preceding the date of the first dispensing
- secondary diabetes
- history of cancer
- end-stage renal disease (ESRD)
- HIV
- organ transplant

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: From Clinformatics and MarketScan source data, patients with a recorded diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) who initiated linagliptin, sitagliptin, saxagliptin, alogliptin, pioglitazone, or 2nd generation sulfonylureas were identified between May 2011 and December 2016.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Only participants with no use of a medication in the same class or comparator class during the 6 months prior to index date, who were at least 18 years of age and enrolled for a minimum of 6 months in the data source before treatment initiation were included.

baseline.population: Participants, who initiated linagliptin, other DPP-4, pioglitazone, or second generation sulfonylureas, were identified from Clinformatics and MarketScan between May 2011 and December 2016.Within each database, a 1:1 propensity score matching was performed between initiators of linagliptin and intiators of each comparator group.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Incident End Stage Renal Disease
outcome.description: Number of participants with incident end stage renal disease (ESRD)
outcome.population: 1:1 propensity score matched cohorts of linagliptin initiators and comparator groups initiators, identified from Clinformatics and MarketScan database between May 2011 and December 2016. For this outcome only, patients with ESRD at any time prior to and including the day of treatment initiation were excluded.

measure.population: 1:1 propensity score matched cohorts of linagliptin initiators and comparator groups initiators, identified from Clinformatics and MarketScan database between May 2011 and December 2016.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Acute Renal Failure Requiring Dialysis
outcome.description: Number of patients with acute renal failure requiring dialysis
outcome.population: 1:1 propensity score matched cohorts of linagliptin initiators and comparator groups initiators, identified from Clinformatics and MarketScan database between May 2011 and December 2016.

reported_events.desc: As this is a non-interventional study with secondary use of data retrieved from a US health claims database, safety monitoring and safety reporting on an individual case level is not applicable.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Pioglitazone is contraindicated among patients with heart failure and edema. This suggests pioglitazone may not be a proper comparator in the assessment of the association between linagliptin and heart failure hospitalization or renal outcomes.
